Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: clpOhio
Reviews.Content: Nice big comfortable bed on 7th floor, room was very nice and large. Bathroom was nice but there was a small rust spot from water dripping, nothing major.Staff was nice..kudos to the breakfast staff

Reviews.Title: “Hair Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: CMR01
Reviews.Content: After waiting in line for at least 40 minutes (they were short staffed at the reception) to get checked in, I walked into the bathroom that had hair all over the place. So I checked the bed...hair on the sheets. I quickly nabbed a housekeeper (who barely spoke English but who understood my concern about a dirty bathroom) and she cleaned it. I slept on the couch. Poor services at reception should have tipped us off. I will never stay there again...this was my 2 time and the last despite the fact that there is no casino or smoke (both good things).

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dynamic81
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to the convention center and they have a shuttle. Good Embassy Suites breakfast and Managers reception in the evenings. Clean & well maintained. Rates seem to be good depending on the time of year you go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JLS300
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a confernce in Las Vegas and stayed at the Embassy Suiites Conv Center for 3 nights. This is your typical Embassy Suites, with reservations. The room itself was overly large. The living room area was about 2x what I expected, and nice. Flat screen TV in both LR and bedroom. Have to say the furnitire could use updating however. Bathroom was clean and functional. Bedroom was, again, nice sized with flat screen tv. Have to say the bed and linens were not all that comfortable. Just could not get used to the bed. Workout room was adequate with cardio and minimal weights. Breakfast was Embassy Suite standard, good selection of made to order and buffet items. Happy hour was popular, and good to grab a drink. Business center has 2 computers for use with a printer. Nice to have. Wifi worked well in my room, never a problem. Only item that would make me think twice before booking again was location. A mile from the strip, the property feels distant at times. there are some places to eat about half a mile away and took advantage of that. The hotel does have transportation to the Strip, but be warned. It is once an hour. That is it. And not exactly to the Strip. They let you off at the Fashion Show Mall ONLY. And in the oddest place at the mall. on the farthest reaches of the mall next to the barbage and loading docks. You then have a 10 minute walk around the mall to get to the strip and begin to walk where you need to go. Only used this once, and did no tuse for th return (you have to call at 15 past to be picked up at 30 past). All in all a typical Embassy Suites property.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable with free happy hour(s)”
Reviews.Author: DTTAMPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights to enjoy a long weekend anniversary getaway. Check in was effortless, we asked for a room with a view of the strip and they gave us one on the 8th floor. We could see most of the back side strip. We arrived late and walked to blocks to Firefly and had a great Tapas dinner. The room was very quiet and the bed was comfortable but very jiggly. Every time one of use moved the other felt it. The breakfast was typical Embassy Suites, but a bit skimpier than usual. For example....there was no peanut butter. The fare was exactly the same everyday. Happy hour staff was warm, friendly, and quick to serve drinks. The snacks were only chips, salsa, and popcorn the nights we were there. Internet was fast and easy to use. Parking was free and easy. There was a 5 minute walk to the monorail which we only used once.

Reviews.Title: “Very good off the strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJPVA
Reviews.Content: For those in town to work, rather than party, this is a super hotel. It is close to the Convention Center (walking distance to South Hall, but drive to North or Central Halls!). Typical Embassy Suites -- lots of room to spread out and be comfortable. Older hotel but clean and well maintained. Manager's reception in early evening; cooked to order hot breakfast (LOVE the omelet chef -- he makes great omelets). Convenient to Las Vegas Boulevard and the strip for those who want to party in the evening. If you have children, this allows you space for them to "spread out", and if you are there to work, set up your computer, log on and have at it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: clynnglover
Reviews.Content: I spent the entire month of February in Las Vegas and stayed here. The staff was wonderful, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good and the restaurant has reasonably priced food that is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Refuge from The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for six nights at the Embassy Suites in February. The front desk was polite and efficient. The hotel was clean and well maintained. While not up to the luxury of many of the hotels on Las Vegas Boulevard, the room was clean and spacious. I had a room with a handicap bathroom - avoid this type of room unless you need it. The bathroom was dimly lit and offers no surface to spread out your toiletries. I used a rental car for my trip, so I had no problem getting around the city. When I did try to use a cab, the front desk was unable to get one appear - I think this is the price of being off The Strip. Breakfast was consistently good and the manager's reception was appreciated on a couple of nights. In general, the hotel was fairly quiet. The walls are paper thin, so if your neighbor invites a few ladies over for a party - you will hear every detail. If I was traveling to Vegas for business, I would strongly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but comparatively pricey”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: Good room and breakfast. Decent pool but the $200+ price was borderline justified. Stayed here 2 years in a row. Paid $75 the first year and $250 in 2012 for the same room. Apparently the hotel is nearly always in demand due to its location next to the convention center. Prob excellent for business travelers who want convenience and distance from the strip, as I did. But there were less expensive options. I'll look into that next time.

Reviews.Title: “No smoky drunken casino.”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum92130
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas with tween kids for an event and this place was perfect. The kids can safely help themselves to the pool and the breakfast without wading through the casino. I like casinos but not with the family. All was good here we rented a car and went to a casino when the time was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay but mangers reception was disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Candace71
Reviews.Content: I really like staying in Embassy Suites hotels. I have stayed in Embassy Suites hotels in Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, and Denver, CO. The check-in staff was nice and I got a upper floor room as requested. One thing I did notice in the lobby is you can smell the chlorine from the swimming pool but not in other places of the hotel. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. When I arrived at the mangers reception there was only popcorn! Usually there is veggies and dip, chips and salsa, and some other things to eat. It was a few days before Christmas and maybe because there were no business travelers they didn't have the usual managers reception? The lady working at the managers reception was very nice to talk to. My husband and I slept well until we were awaken by the fire alarm at 7 am. We wanted to sleep a little longer since we were tired from traveling the day before. We did enjoy our breakfast. Since I have read about the fire alarm issues in other reviews, I'm not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel off strip”
Reviews.Author: Louise40
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I travel to LV many times aa year. This hotel is centrally Located, clean and most importantly off the strip, a shuttle is available to the strip. Evening reception is good and breakfast excellent. I have stayed here for 10 years now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: aussiekiwi_boy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is off the strip, very quiet - we found being off the strip no issue, there is so much free parking at the hotels on the strip that driving in for shows etc was easy. Worth having a look

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Las Vegas Conventions”
Reviews.Author: Carib-Travel56
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but is in a great location for Convention Center events. The rooms are large with separate living area and bedroom. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle that goes to the convention center and the strip. There is a complimentary buffet breakfast in the morning and a manager's coctail receptiom in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of issues but generally a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Roman0209
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in a one-bedroom suite on the 5th floor. The room was quiet and clean with a small balcony and view of the strip, two flat screen tvs and a bar with refrigerator and microwave. The breakfast was good with several choices, including made-to-order omelets. The manager's reception included free well drinks, beer, and wine with tortilla chips/salsa one night and potato chips/dip the other night we went. The monorail station at the convention center is within walking distance. The issues we had were as follows: 1. With the concern of water such an issue in Las Vegas, it was disturbing to have to run the water for over 10 minutes just to get a lukewarm temperature. Management indicated they were waiting for a slow period to repair the heater, but I wonder if that's not just a fact of life since the heater is in the back of the hotel. 2. The fire alarm went off at 4 am one morning and 7 am the next morning. False alarm, but we were told that it's a recurring problem and really needs to be fixed. 3. We were able to bring our pet which was nice; however, the cost seems pretty prohibitive in my opinion. The advertised charge is $50/night + tax. We ended up paying $100 + tax for four nights. They say they deep clean the rooms after a pet stays, but the cost still seems high. All in all, the hotel worked fine for us since we had our dog along but probably would try another hotel next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip but good value”
Reviews.Author: Teamhoffmann
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off the strip behind the Wynn hotels. It was a short walk to the easy to use monorail. While the hotel is getting to be a little dated, everything was clean and well maintained. I thought the people were friendly and welcoming. The bartenders were busy at the free managers reception but stayed in good spirits. Tad was attentive and quick to wait on people. The free breakfast saved us some money and was good. My eggs were cooked well both days. Plenty of choices. The rooms were clean and large. We stayed in a two room king suite. Nice view of the strip hotels. While there are a ton of hotels in Vegas that are on the strip and fancier, I thought this was a good choice at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “great time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: judy b
Reviews.Content: Very nice and quiet hotel in Las Vegas...excellent reception and huge breakfast...good for traveling with family..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are ok being off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Erika20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our reservation on the Strip began. I used Hilton Honors points, so I can't speak to the price. The cab ride from the airport was $20, including tip. Check in was super speedy, and they had a king suite available for us at 11am - we were very happy to have a room that early, especially on a Saturday. There is complimentary water in the lobby. The managers reception included free draft beer, wine, mixed drinks, popcorn and chips and salsa. The free made to order breakfast was just that - it included omelets made to order, sausage, bacon, scambled eggs, pancakes, pastries, coffee, juice and soda. Much bigger and nicer than most "free" breakfasts. We had the 2 room king suite. The living room was very large, as was the separate bedroom (they are separated by a door.) Both rooms had a flat screen TV. There is also a wet bar with a fridge and coffee maker. The bathroom was large with a hair dryer and had nice toiletries. I was most impressed with the towels and bed linens - much higher quality than I would have expected. Overall, I think this is a solid property. The drawback is location. It is located 3 long blocks from the monorail station (about an 8 minute walk). This is great during daylight hours, but it is not an area you would want to walk after it is dark. We took a taxi to/from the strip and it ran about $12 with tip both ways. If you are ok paying a taxi, and not having a casino, I think this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: terps1962
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Be warned, it is away from casinos. Room was comfortable. If staying for business, it is a perfect fit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families - separate bedroom, great breakfast - a little tired/dated”
Reviews.Author: dg_in_ca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the one in Glendale, CA and that was amazing - comparatively this one was not nearly as nice. Nice to have separate bedroom when traveling with kids and that is why we stayed here. There are a lot of "suites" in Vegas - but they do not mean a separate bedroom. The location is in an iffy area. You will not want to go for a walk around here and I would not want to stay here without a car. The front desk staff were all great - so nice and helpful! The furnishings feel old - especially the upholstery on the pull out couch. Small rooms - no closets. Manager's reception was disappointing - popcorn every night. Hummus and pita...(Glendale had great veggies trays and hot appetizers). Breakfast here was great - made to order eggs - awesome omelets! Fresh fruit, cereal, hot food, etc... Great breakfast. Nice business center - 2 computers and printers. Pool area was cold - the doors to the outside were open (in November)! Huge outdoor hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Family place away from Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Manateegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed like a pretty good bargain, but it could have been anywhere. It is perfect for families especially those that don't want a slot machine everywhere you go. This hotel did not have any obvious gambling stations in the lobby (slot machines). The staff were friendly and helpful. We loved the quiet of the hotel. The atrium is pretty. The afternoon snacks were yummy. They had chips and salsa and popcorn along with drinks at the managers reception. The cooked to order breakfast was really tasty and they had plenty of choices. Bananas, apples, cereals, pastries, eggs, bacon, sausage, omelets, French toast. Lots to choose from. They seemed to have a pretty lax policy where you can take food to your rooms. Approximately $14 cab ride from airport. About $12 to the MGM Grand. A bit out of the way, but quiet. Would come back if I didn't need to be on the strip too much.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a frequent traveler”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving. For someone who is not a big traveler, or has not stayed in the new or refurbished ES hotels, this place is great. Otherwise, it is very dated, smaller than typical suites, and inconsistent service. Breakfast was typical for ES. The cook however made incredibly fast omelettes (like in 2 minutes). That's not always a bad thing, but presentation was pretty bad and I was a bit concerned about the level of cooking, but on closer inspection, it was actually a bit overdone. Obviously he is used to high volume. This is not your typical Las Vegas hotel. Very very family and kid filled-kids all over. Great location, very very close to the Strip on the Wynn/Encore portion. Not quite walking distance, but a short drive or taxi ride. Room was generally clean, but fold out bed for my son was not. I made my way to a housekeeping closet and grabbed some sheets to replace it. Pillows were an issue--only halfway filled with down and too soft. Overall, not horrifying, but not the best. On a scale of 1 to 10 for Embassy Suites, a definite "5". Front desk service was very good, guest request/housekeeping attitude great--a decent choice if you need an economical larger room away from the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “" I LOVE this place!"”
Reviews.Author: cydona46
Reviews.Content: Actually this is a quote from my 13 year old granddaughter. But I have to agree. I admit I'm a fan of Embassy Suites. Especially when traveling with our grandchildren and ES Las Vegas was no different. The rate was amazingly reasonable. Check in was flawless and friendly. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet.Yes, it is away from the strip but we had no problem with a 10 and 13 year old walking to it. We drove at night to take them to see the Beatles LOVE performance (HIGHLY recommended) at the Mirage. We could have walked but opted not to at night based on some of Tripadvisor reviews. That said, we felt more safe with the kids in the hotel area than on the strip! We always enjoy the managers reception and the kids take full advantage of the indoor pool and the cooked to order breakfast. Really...there isn't a better deal in town. When my husband and I go back, we will opt for one of the rooms with a balcony. Looks VERY cool!

Reviews.Title: “Old, clean, quiet - Stay for the breakfast - not the balcony”
Reviews.Author: ZIPPY87ME
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites is average at best. We selected it because of the location and price. We stayed one night at the beginning of our national park drive and one night before heading home. The hotel is generally quiet if you stay away from the elevators. I would suggest the back of the hotel. It is one of the smaller Embassy Suites I have stayed at, which was nice. Parking was close to the front door and well lighted at night. Unlike the strip hotels you don’t have to mess with valet parking or the wait to get your car and there are no slot machines in the lobby. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Don’t, I repeat don’t, get suckered into paying extra for a balcony with a double queen bed room. The description online for the rooms implies that the balcony is large and features patio furniture, this is only true for the single king rooms on the front of the building. The rooms with two queen beds have a 20 square foot balconies at best that you can stand on and watch the traffic from the side of the building. For this pleasure you pay extra. I really suggest that Hilton makes this clearer on their website, for those of us who use the internet to make reservations. The breakfast was great, I have not found an Embassy Suite yet that failed this test. The staff was friendly at check in and the staff at the breakfast area was very friendly. The two bar tenders at the managers reception should find other jobs. While standing in line for our complementary cokes and cranberry juice, all we had to listen to was them complaining about how people kept asking for “top shelf” alcohol and how stupid they were to think that it would be available for “free”. That combined with the plain nacho chips and salsa that was the only food offered; made me wonder why they bother offering this. Just make the room price less expensive and give it up because this was an embarrassing excuse for a reception. Another consistent complaint about Embassy Suites is the charge for internet service. Come on, even Hamptons give you access for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the strip...”
Reviews.Author: brw_engel
Reviews.Content: This property is located just the behind the golf course at the Wynn. It's about a four block walk to the strip or they have a free shuttle that drops you at the Fashion Mart. They have a free wonderful full breakfast and where else can you get free drinks for two hours (without gambling)?

Reviews.Title: “A Tired Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: ardmoreflyer
Reviews.Content: I'm generally quite pleased with Embassy Suites properties but this one just seems to be a bit tired. It's seen better days. Our room, which was supposed to be non-smoking, smelled like smoke. Luckily we were only there for 2 nights. The breakfast buffet was great. Good, friendly service, although I'm used to the breakfast buffets at other Embassy's where you serve yourself. When I took a plate from the stack and went for some eggs, the cook politely asked me for the plate so he could serve it. I think it's their way of rationing the food. It's breakfast food, whatever. We spent most of our time out on the strip. The hotel is nice and close to the Convention Center stop on the monorail. That made it an easy trip over to the strip. I didn't deal with the front desk but they seemed to be very friendly and helpful. This isn't a bad place by any means, just a little worn out. It could use a breath of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “After reading some reviews, I expected a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jkskeen
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on this hotel, I expected a nightmare. I expected my car being broken into, drunks and homeless all over the hotel, but guess what? I had a wonderful stay. The staff were very kind, and helpful. They accomodated my long extended checkout needs. The pool and spa were great and I did not encounter one homeless guy taking a bath in it! Imagine that. Breakfast was decent, the beds were great and the room was very quiet. My only negative was the TV remote was missing, but they broiught one up. It is about a 10 minute walk to the convention center if you have the need for that. They also have a shuttle that goes there every hour and also they were kind enough to provide a free shuttle ride to the mall every hour as well. Overall I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet accommodations right off the strip”
Reviews.Author: heatherh1313
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were looking for a hotel that is quiet, near the strip and has extra space for our family and we found just that. The hotel is in a nice location and is a quick cab ride away from the strip. The complimentary full cooked to order breakfast was nice, however, was extremely crowded on Saturday morning due to a convention. Because this is a convention hotel, I would have expected the whole experience to be more organized and staff to be more prepared, but that was not the case. I will say that it seemed to be a "all hands on deck" type of situation, where all staff was assisting in any way that they could, but it didn't seem to be enough. By the time we got there (around 930), it was complete chaos (running out of supplies, long lines, mass confusion). But, I will give them the benefit out of the doubt because Sunday morning was a completely different scenario and seemed to be much less crowded and more organized. We did go down earlier, so this could have been the reason. Regardless, we all enjoyed the rooms and the hotel itself and would stay there again. but would get there early for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: beetrvln
Reviews.Content: Once again we found ourselves at the Embassy Suites near the Convention Center in Las Vegas and were not disappointed. The hotel is clean, quiet and parking is easy. This hotel does not have a casino and is so easy to get in and out of. You don't find yourself trapsing miles through the casino to the registration desk and then miles back to the elevator to get to your room. The Manager's special drinks and snacks is so nice and the breakfast service was quick, efficient and very good. We love staying off of the strip away from the Mega hotels and having some peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “What Happens in Vegas, Needs Fixing”
Reviews.Author: DrFood
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in the property in year. Last year, October 2010, was a decent stay. This year was a mess. Poor and rude front desk help. Disgusting managers reception. Out dated rooms. Poor response from management staff when I wrote a lengthy email to Hilton Honors folks. Asst Manager sent a generic we are sorry you were not happy response. People should be fired for things that happened, not "talked to" as she said would happen. Where the heck is the GM at on handling the letter to Honors? I skipped the breakfast after the nasty managers reception food quality. Would be a hotel of almost last resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Below average for and Embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: rhartogs
Reviews.Content: Rooms were fine and on par with Embassy Suites, clean, spacious, living room area a bit too dark. The breakfast as always was pretty solid. My bed was too soft. What I didn't like was the tiny over chlorinated pool, small work out center that was hard to find, and the restaurant that didn't feel like a restaurant, more like tables set up in the middle of the atrium. Though the seafood chowder and hot wings were pretty good. Aside from the lady who checked me in, most of the staff were indifferent. The bar/reception area was smaller than I would have liked. And the bartenders were pretty vigilant about showing your key card to them with ID to get drinks, making the long lines go way too slow. Getting taxis there is not easy. You have to have the front desk call and then wait and hope no one gets in the cab before you. The neighborhood is not a good one to walk around in. Lots of strung out vagrants. So walking at night to the limited amount of restaurants within walking distance is not too advised.

Reviews.Title: “New Found Love for Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: jill v
Reviews.Content: When my friend told me that we were going to Vegas and NOT staying on the strip and at an Embassy Suites, I was a little discourage. I thought, who goes to Vegas and doesn't stay on the strip??? After staying at Embassy Suites, I completely changed my mind. We arrived on a Friday evening at 6 pm just in time to catch the end of complimentary cocktails and snacks in the bar. Before I knew it I had made friends with some visiting Aussies and it was midnight. The next morning we woke up to custom omelets and a full buffet style breakfast. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. A complimentary shuttle will take and pick you up on the strip at a convenient location. I loved the service and the amenities that I have decided that our next trip to Miami we will be staying at an Embassy Suites

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our recent trip to vegas. The room was wonderful. it had a nice living room area, a kitchenette, a full bath, and nice separate bedroom. The room nicely furnished, quiet and comfortable. The cooked to order breakfast was hot and delicious. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The strip was visible from our top floor window; however the hotel itself is a little more than a mile away by road. Transportation to and from the main strip was easily accomplished via the monorail system, with a station about two blocks from the hotel itself. I'm definitely staying there again on my next trip to vegas.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: MrsK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights during cloudy, rainy weather. Room was OK, clean and spacious. Breakfast was somewhat crowded and chaotic, but had a big selection, did not try the cocktail reception. Hotel is far from the strip and you need to walk to the Convention Center to get the bus, which is about a half a mile. They have a shuttle to the CC, but it does not run very often and is "on demand" which is not very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: StellaArtoisH
Reviews.Content: Nice large and comfy well appointed suites. Free parking, a nice little fitness room and a killer free breakfast. My only complaint is that the coffee was horrible. Quiet. A little over a mile walk to the strip. I walked it several times and felt completely safe.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I remember”
Reviews.Author: YesAnotherTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at a couple of Embassy Suites several years ago (Tahoe, Palm Springs & San Diego), and don't remember it being as dated as this location was. This place has seen it's better days. There was mold in the shower, and the drain was clogged with hair that I had to pull out to get the shower to drain before I even went in. It was the middle of the night, so I wasn't going to call & wait for maintenance to come & get more frustrated with the wait when I just wanted to sleep. So I had to wear my flipflops in the shower. (As a side note, this is the 2nd hotel in a row that this has happened -- I don't know why housekeeping doesn't seem to care about this...) The hotel advertises a free afternoon reception. When we asked the front desk about what type of things are offered there, he said, "sometimes chicken, generally cheesesticks." We were hungry, and headed over, only to find popcorn and chips & salsa. Nothing else, a half hour into the "reception." A weird thing is that my friends had bottled water in their refrigerator, which the front desk told them was free. But I didn't have any in my refrigerator, which made me wonder if they had forgotten to clean the refrigerator out, and if the water belonged to a previous guest? The positives are the amount of space in the room and availability of parking up front... But this place has definitely seen it's better days. I will not be staying at another Embassy Suites after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: robbase75
Reviews.Content: now anyone that travels and is worried about where to stay if you have doubts and dont have hang-ups on lavishness then Embassy Suites is and will always be the place to stay, I've stayed in alot of them and never a complaint. The LV Embassy is located just 1 block fron the strip right by the Hilton. As i see it for the vegas locations it doesn't make much sense to eat at Embassy when you have excellent food everywhere you look so we didnt eat there. The rooms of course were excellent, the bar was questionable, they claimed to have run out of alot of stuff?? But again like the food theres liquor everywhere so dont trip. My next Embassy stop...................... Miami yeah baby

Reviews.Title: “Best value around!”
Reviews.Author: opusRaleigh
Reviews.Content: Perhaps because Las Vegas is over-hoteled or the economy, but we got a terrific deal on a suite here, including a free buffet breakfast that included cooks making made-to-order omelets, eggs and waffles. The rooms are well taken care of. It is not convenient to the strip, but if you don't mind a 20-minute walk for exercise, it's not a problem. Our only complaint was that they held a manager's reception but the food was pretty skimpy. We were staying one night before flying out at the end of a trip to the Grand Canyon, Bryce and Zion. It was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean place”
Reviews.Author: nolaqueen
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times and pleased each time. Love that bed in closed off to rest of room so if you want sleep and others are out, they don't wake you coming in. Staff friendly, helpful. Room service good. Not far from strip but to far to walk back to your room after dark. I felt most places away from strip were generally unsafe to walk around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Even A Diamond Honors Member Can't Get A Break”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of a letter I'd sent to Hilton Honors. Hello. My name is Brian, Hilton Honors Member XXXXXXXX. I am writing this letter to withdraw my membership in Hilton Honors. I no longer wish to be a member of Hilton Honors, and will not spend another dollar with your hotels. Not that it will matter to you, but I am going to explain why that after 96 nights in less than 1 year I am doing this. My last four or five stays with you were miserable by anyone’s interpretation of the word. Since it was my most recent trip that forced my hand, I will describe it to you. Checked in on 09/8/2011 at the Embassy Suites on Paradise Rd in Las Vegas. I’d checked in for four nights, yet had to obtain new keys daily because they’d kept checking us out. (Room 920) Found major rust stains in the bathtub, where my daughter, age 9 would have bathed. Disgusting. Morning of 09/09/2011…breakfast. Discovered mold on bread that my daughter had eaten. Mine and that had by my wife had mold on it as well. Staff joked that there was no extra charge for the mold, but we didn’t find that funny. They’d cleared the bread from the table. Morning of 09/10/2011…evidentially the joke was on us, because we were fortunate to have received more moldy bread. We’d stopped eating in your hotel after that. Afternoon of 9/10/2011…returned to the room at 3:00 p.m. The room had yet to made up, no towels…nothing. We were told by the front desk that not having the room cleaned by 5:00 p.m. was normal!!! Really?!?! Because if that’s true, I’ve been pretty fortunate over the years. Afternoon of 9/11/2011…retuned to the room at 2:30 p.m….guess what? No towels, no clean. Evening of 9/11/2011…remarked that lowering the flag to half-staff on the anniversary of 911 was something the hotel should consider…especially with military personnel staying at the hotel. Evening of 9/11/2011…toilet breaks. Go downstairs to report it. The woman behind the desk asks me to stick my hand inside the toilet to “fix the rubber thing” inside. Needless to say, I’d declined. We used the lobby restrooms that evening. The major problem I have is that I’d spent a lot points for this trip for my family. If I’d paid, I’d be seeking a refund! Just one bit of advise and then I promise you will never hear from me again…If your staff treats Diamond members this way, how do normal everyday folks get treated? Perhaps the Hilton’s ought to spend less time partying in LA and just a bit more time focusing on customer service…especially for those of us who practically live in your lousy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place A+ rating will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: AllYearGymRats
Reviews.Content: This place was great from the elegant designs of the hotel lobby and all around atmosphere. We were here for our daughter's volleyball tournament. Our room was huge, clean, and modern. The beds were very comfortable and bedding felt very clean. The bedroom being separate from the living room was especially enjoyed. My wife loves to sleep in and I enjoy waking up, having coffee and breakfast. She was not disturbed even by the TV in the living room. The cook to order breakfast was excellent. Omelets, scrambled eggs, French toast, pancakes, juice, milk, oatmeal, breads, beacon, and sausage. The staff was "very" friendly. The managers cocktail hours was good for the alcohol but the snacks were very much lacking, taco chips from a bag and candy corn not so great, but what can one expect “it was free alcohol.” There was no casino or machines anywhere in the hotel which was nice. We every much enjoyed this hotel and give it an A++ for design, clean rooms, great breakfast, accommodations. Indoor pool looked nice too. The parking lot was close to the hotel. We filled up our ice chests from the ice machines which were plenty full of ice. Thank you Embassy you did not disappoint!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamtravellers
Reviews.Content: If you need a place that is clean, quiet, friendly and not too expensive choose this Embassy hotel. Staff went out of their way to help. Breakfast is great with lots of choice, rooms are comfortable and pool was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gallerygirltoo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this Embassy Suites to attend the Star Trek Convention because he has Hilton Points. It was excellent! The room was spacious, the bed very comfortable, and stocked well with towels and anything else we might need. The hotel is off the strip, so allows for some quiet time, but it very close to the monorail to get to where the action is. There is a complimentary breakfast with made-to-order omelets as well as all the other hot breakfast items, which saved us much time and money. The line is longer on the weekend, but still not bad. The indoor pool is nice and they have a huge hot tub outside. The bartenders were friendly and accomodating. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Away from Casino noise for Families”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBruce
Reviews.Content: 2 full blocks off the strip but just a free shuttle away. No casino noise and a nice simple location. Free breakfast until 10:30 every weekend morning and 10 on weekdays that includes awesome omlettes and anything else you might find in a full breakfast (consider what you might pay for a breakfast elsewhere). Free shuttle leaves for the strip (Fashion Mall), convention center or monorail station every hour on the half hour. Call for pick up on the same schedule without a problem. Appears to be good place for those needing access to the Convention Center as well. The hotel rooms all have full suite amenities. Only drawback for us was double beds but we did make use of the pullout sofa bed in front room. Don't forget to get free drinks at the bar from 5:30 to 7:30 each night too. Fitness area quite functional with universal machine and even free weight dumbells. Pool area indoors and outdoors for year round use.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip”
Reviews.Author: 24kK9s
Reviews.Content: No casino - great free breakfast - very nice lobby - Jason at reception was terrific & Day the bartender was very nice. Good place to stay if you are in Vegas on business. Off the strip - quiet - walking distance to the Hardrock.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times”
Reviews.Author: mlmoore3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location to avoid traffic from the Strip. You can never go wrong with the complimentary made to order breakfast or Manager's Reception with free cocktails. If there was a casino in the place it would have been even better.

Reviews.Title: “close to convention center but...”
Reviews.Author: brucejkirch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times due to its proximity to the convention center (less than 10 minutes walk) and its participation in Hilton Honours. The hot breakfast and open bar "managers reception" is a nice perk as well. The extended breakfast hours on the weekend was gret. Breakfast was served till 10:30 AM. However on Monday, breakfast was over at 9. The line to get an omelet must have been 50 long! No more yogorts, bannanas, or pastries! Beware of the weekdays! Go early!

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kswim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February 2011 and again in April and will definitely be back again. This is a nice hotel with friendly staff and great pricing. The cook to order breakfast is delicious and a great start to the day. The hotel is in a good location near the Wynn (great location if you have a car) and in a nicer area than the other Embassy property appears to be in. The evening reception, also included, is very social and a perfect way to relax before dinner. The suites are also very nice and so roomy compared to the small hotel style rooms you tend to get on the strip. This is my favorite place to stay if you don't need to be right in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good but no fuss!”
Reviews.Author: SMurphyDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good, but not themed or fancy like the other hotels in Vegas. it could be in any city! I personally expected a bit more theatricality in a vegas hotel design. the rooms are great and the free bar and nipples between 5.30pm-7.30pm was fantastic. the hotel is not on the strip however the shuttle bus which leaves every hour is much welcomed. it is very close to the convention centre also. I would stay here again as i got a great deal but do look at the wynn and the venetian, fantatsic hotels on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Good normal hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: msmont
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, everything looked either new or refurbished. Comfortable beds and nice living room area. Bathroom was new and had good water pressure. Went to the managers reception and it had good drinks and food. The breakfast was also very good but was very crowded in the morning. I didn't see where the tram was but was probably more than I wanted to walk so I rented a car. Parking was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable off-strip hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Parul75
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with a 5 year old, and had a comfortable stay at this hotel. This is a great hotel if you want to stay off the strip, in a hotel without a casino. The rooms are large - there is a sitting area separate from the sleeping area, which works great if you have kids. There are 2 TVs in the two rooms, and there is also a coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. The refrigerator was especially useful for storing fruits and snacks for our 5 year old. The room decor was fine, but can do with some updating. The bathrooms are clean and the toiletries decent. The complimentary breakfast offers a decent t spread including breads, meat, cereal, yogurt, muffins and fruits. I thought that the made to order eggs were especially good. The pool looked good, although we did not use it. Some negatives: 1. We had a car, so we could drive to the strip. Walking to and from the strip in the night would have taken some time. 2. You have to pay for using the Internet in your room. ($10 for the day)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family”
Reviews.Author: bobcat_chica
Reviews.Content: We have a new baby (was 3 months old for the trip) and we wanted a hotel where we wouldn't be disturbed too much by the late night crowds & would have enough room for the baby stuff. The Embassy was perfect...plenty of room in the suite for all our suitcases plus the baby "crib" from the hotel (is just a pack n play). Bedroom is in the back of the suites so even though the door to your room opens into the open common area it's quiet in the bedroom no matter what time of day. I had to go down to breakfast a few times on my own with the baby & all the staff that was helping with breakfast were SO friendly & helpful. One woman carried my tray for me while I got food & was pushing my baby around. Even the men working down there were oogling over the baby...never thought I'd see that! Breakfast has the cook to order omelets, but also has regular hot breakfast stuff like potatoes, eggs, & meats, plus there's fruit, cereal, bagels, English muffins, donuts, toast..more than enough to get you filled up for the morning! We rented a car & the hotel was just a short drive to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever.”
Reviews.Author: Glitzr
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay , No line ups, Very friendly staff, The rooms were huge with a fridge, great coffee maker , Really comfy beds, super clean, modern decor .Air was really cool and with it being over 100 very well appreciated . Bonus fresh cooked breakfast every morning no line ups for that , Managers cocktail party every night from 5:30 to 7:30 with great drinks ,friendly bartenders . Didn't use the pool , but it was nice . No it is not on the strip but I really liked that , an 8 min walk to the Monorail , a little exercise was great . Would stay there next time for sure .

Reviews.Title: “Managers Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: margaritattu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first 2 nights of my 7 night stay in Vegas. The room had 2 double beds with a flatscreen with a seperate living room with an indiviudal coffee maker, microwave and fridge. The beds were very comfy and it was nice to be able to keep leftovers (since food is not cheap). our first night we attended the Managers Happy Hour from 5:30-7:30 where there was unlimited FREE drinks! Free liquor drinks, beer and wine! They served pretzels, and nachos with beans. Definately helped save money. The next night we were exhausted and ate at the restaurant in the hotel. The food was good, nothing exceptional but convenient. This hotel is definately not the party place that Planet Hollywood was but it had some nice perks. It was within walking distance of the convention center where our conference was located. The monorail station is very close. It was inconveneint for my friend to stay here and try to hang out at Planet Hollywood with the rest of us...cab rides were around $10 each way from Embassy to PH. She did not feel comfortable walking from the Embassy to the monorail station after dark. It is rather poorly lit in that area. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Embassy and would recommend if you are not wanting a "vegas" feel. It is quite and comfy and the managers happy hour can definately save you some money on partying. The rooms are nice as always and according to my friend, have not had bed bugs issues.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in one of the rooms with a large patio and it was wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: DirectThreat
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful , the hotel was clean and pretty. We stayed in one of the rooms with a large patio and we loved it. It had a great view and we didn't want to leave the patio it was so nice. We ended up having drinks and sitting out there for a few hours. The night time free reception includes free drinks, beer, well drinks, soda etc. They also offered free nachos , popcorn, pretzels. In the morning we had a full breakfast with cooked to order omelets. Overall we had a great experience. This hotel is a hidden gem !

Reviews.Title: “Average Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: kdwarren
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler, and stayed at this hotel on points. The location is convenient to the airport and the strip, and not far from a monorail station. This was an older hotel, not the best, but definatley not the worst. We checked in and the front desk staff were very nice. Being a frequent traveler, I always do a "sweep" of the room when I walk in. I pulled back the bedding and it looked like Big Foot had slept in that bed the night before. I called the front desk, and they were very apologetic and put us in a different room. Room 2 was much cleaner. My biggest complaint had to be with the occupants in the room next to us. We could hear everything - they must have had 40 people staying in that room. So, we didn't get much rest. Thin walls - I guess. Breakfast was very good, my husband enjoyed the eggs cooked to order. Again, all of the service staff were very kind and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: misskalli
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the value for this hotel was like as it was paid for by my Boyfriends company. He was down there for a tradeshow/convention. I met him down there when he was finished and stayed in the hotel for one night. He had been there for 4 already and it was a great time for him regarding the room/hotel. The desk staff was very friendly (I tend to call down with questions a lot lol) and helpful. The room was fantastic. A little dark in the living room as there are no windows to the outside, just to the outside hallway so you always need the lights on. Bed was very comfortable and I slept pretty good. Everything was very clean, the bathroom was fantastic, although when I went to take a bath at about 1am the water would not go hot. It was fine the next day though. This was a fantastic hotel if you're looking to stay off the strip. We had a car to drive to the strip so I don't know how long the walk would be. Another downside is that internet costs $10 for 24 hours of connection :(

Reviews.Title: “Large room. Great free breakfast. Love the complimentary cocktails.”
Reviews.Author: northstarshoediva
Reviews.Content: We really like the Embassy Suites properties overall. The two rooms and 2 TVs are great and you do not feel claustrophobic if you are staying more than a night. The breakfast was excellent--especially the cooked to order omelets. The only disappointing thing this time was there were some stains on the living carpet. It didn't seem dirty but the marks kind of turned me off. Bathroom was clean, bedroom was clean, and bed was comfortable. Decent toiletries. Had to ask for a room cleaning at one point--desk clerk tried to get out of talking to housekeeping but did and they did it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tim805
Reviews.Content: I like Embassy Suites but was dissapointed with this hotel. We called the office requesting a blanket at 7:30 because my son was going to sleep on the fold out couch. A few minutes later they called back and spoke to my child stating no blankets were available. I called back to clarify since I thought my son must have misunderstood. No, the women said they did not have any blankets. I suggested she go into one of the unoccupied rooms and obtain a blanket. No, that was not possible. I then told her that the fold out couch was broken and two metal bars were laying on the floor once we opened the bed. She wanted to know if I wanted the maintance man to come and fix it. I told her since there were no extra blankets then there was no point in fixing it but they should note it for the record and not rent that room with a broken bed. I found it hard to beleive they could not accommidate such a simple request. Embassy Suites needs to deliver better quality then this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful service, wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: LSusanneCart
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. Being in Vegas for business seems easier if I am staying off the strip. I really enjoy the manager event daily that helps to chat with others in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect hotel to stay at while traveling with your family or friends”
Reviews.Author: kialahj
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and two small children where traveling to Las Vegas to attend a family wedding and i thought there would be no better place to stay at than the Embassy Suites!! We arrived at the property fairly early in the morning, and I was greeted by Ricky Estiban GSA who was very friendly and accomdating. He informed me that there werent any rooms available at that time, but offered to call me on my cell phone when a room became available. To my surprise, i recieved a call from him about an hour later. This was very helpfull because my children were tired from our long drive from Cali. When i arrived back at the property Denise Lund greeted me with a smile and gave me the smoothest check in. She also showed interest as to why i was visiting the area, and told me to have a great time. The treatment i received was authentic, friendly and accomodating, and i wouldnt stay any where else in Vegas!!! They also gave me a clean fresh room on the 11th floor with a great view!!! Thanks so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: aks120LasVegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights and it was a nice hotel. Just what you would expect from an Embassy Suites. It was in a little bit of an odd place, and you would need to drive to the strip. There was a PF Changs and Gordon Biersch within walking distance. There was not a great atmosphere most of the time but the manager's function was always very busy - a lot of children at it. I probably would not stay here again, however that is more to do with the variety of hotels in Vegas rather than anything particularly wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Service”
Reviews.Author: brettholland45
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outdated. The worst part is they ruined a $60 dollar shirt and then tried to pretend they could send it to the cleaners to fix there hole their iron made. I AM OWED THE MONEY AND WILL NOT stop until I get it!!! I filed a complaint with management I was in room 425. Get in touch with me they are all crooks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is OK”
Reviews.Author: coastsearcher
Reviews.Content: PROS: Nice quiet alternative to the noisy casino hotels. Most of the hotel staff were extremely courteous and helpful. The indoor pool is clean, warm and spacious...a must for families coming to vegas in colder weather. Complimentary breakfast was very nice with plenty of choices to please everyone. The manager's reception is a very nice treat with free cocktails, nachos and popcorn. Business center was nice also. Close to the convention center. Free parking. CONS: Our room was not as clean as it should have been and desperately needs a makeover. The pullout sofa was badly broken making even sitting on it not realistic. The desk was falling apart, the chair had holes in the arms from wear. Be careful walking to and from the hotel as I was told the neighborhood is a little rough. The onsite restaraunt has inconsistent quality standards. I ate there nightly for a week and was happy except for Tue & Wed night...on Tue my food was way overcooked to the point of being black. On Wed. night my food was RAW. The outdoor spa was heated nicely, but consistently had cig. butts and debris floating in it. SUMMARY: An OK hotel for business or travel, but would be a great hotel with a little updating.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: loriny66
Reviews.Content: this hotel was really nice it was close to everything we rented a car and had no problem finding our way around , the hotel has easy access to all areas, the rooms do need updated but very nice. the cooked to order breakfast was good and the evening managers reception is how we started every night they had snacks and the drinks were great it was busy everynight. I liked very much that this was a non smoking hotel and there were no noisy slot machines we weren to the casino then came back to fresh air and quiet. wish they had a better shuttle service we used it one night but took a taxi back because pick up location is not very convienient. the driver of the shuttle also told us to stay at the other embassy next time cause it is better....who knows maybe it was...we liked the indoor pool and outdoor hot tub overall a great place to stay. we might try the other embassy it is a lot closer to the strip and right across from hard rock which we really enjoyed....but i would definetly recommend this hotel staff was very nice also

Reviews.Title: “ugh---what a smell”
Reviews.Author: MarJan6861
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and returned this time to visit some friends. Check-in was efficient, but we were surprised that the desk staff did not acknowledge our Hilton Honors status. Maybe that is the reason they gave us a very standard room that upon entering nearly knocked us over with a sewage smell. We went back to the registration desk and we were given another room. It was a standard room and looked its age. Breakfasts were good as was the evening social. There is no room safe. The hotel had a shuttle that leaves the bottom of each hour and drops you off at a fashion mall across the street from the Wynn. We were the only people on the shuttle but the driver said she was not permitted to take us to a more convenient location that we wanted. Also, there is no airport shuttle. The lobby fountain was not working----we have enjoyed it during previous visits. The hotel is located off the strip. Also during our 5 day stay, not once when we walked by the front desk did any clerk look up and greet us or even give us a nod.

Reviews.Title: “easy location!!”
Reviews.Author: NoDoubtFan82
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for new years and the location couldnt have worked out better. Since they close the strip for new years traffic is a nightmare!! the monorail was a short 5 min walk and a quick 5 min ride and we were in the center of the strip, if we waited for a taxi and waited in traffic it would have been hours to get there. the rooms were nice and clean plenty of room since we stayed with another couple. they had a good spread for breakfast which was very quick and easy. my only complaint which has nothing to do with the hotel was the location of our room. we got put right in front of the elevator, so there was a lot of foot traffic. we slept one night out on the sofabed and i was woken up alot by people getting on and off the elevator. maids collecting dishes and people in genral waiting for the elevator. though i was glad to be on the second floor, the atrium is huge and seems scary if your drunk when you come back to your room. easy location!! nice and clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Danhedonia
Reviews.Content: Checked in late; did not get upgraded room. Also, front desk failed to let me know my package was waiting. So: 3 stars for service. Location is very, very handy: close enough to Strip for easy access, but also far enough for easy on-site parking, less traffic. For rest of town, not too near an on ramp, but reasonable enough. Rooms are typical suites: old, but serviceable. Everything worked, nothing was gross; bed had a great mattress and bathroom was excellent (water pressure, amenities). Nothing pretty. View was very good; balcony is tiny (and dangerous - NOT for those with kids) but afforded fresh air when I wished. Internet connection is passable, though not as fast as some of the best. Breakfast was simply wonderful: EVERYTHING you could ask for, from the very healthy (good array of fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, whole grain breads) to not (omelette bar, bacon and sausage, etc.). I am not price-conscious about meals, but aside from the $ value, I truly appreciate having the options on-site. Did not use the gym; did not see it. Internet is $9.95 if not an Hhonors VIP. This ES is not fancy, but provides all mod cons with a new nice touches at a very reasonable price. Given the age of the room furnishings I would not call this a great spot for a romantic getaway (there are places on the Strip in this price range that are better for that), but for business travel to LV I now have a new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Business Appropriate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tovin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 23-26th while attending training class for work in the area. Check-in was quick, and professional. The walkin and lobby area was gorgeous with a beautiful fountain and plush leather seats. The ottomons were hard to get up off of in the morning, both because they were comfortable and because they was so plush! My co-worker always drove, so I'm not sure how access was. It seemed acceptable, and there was always plenty of parking available, which was free. The evening reception had popcorn, pretzels, as well as chips and salsa, all 3 nights. The drinks were fantastic and the bar service moved quickly with all requests as well as bussing tables quickly, as they emptied. My room was clean, comfortable, had all the amenities one expects from an Embassy Suites, and as a HHonors member I had free internet access. I was scared the water temperature might not be up to par at first, but after a few extra seconds it heated up nicely, and there were no problems at all with having as much hot water as I wanted. The fridge is always appreciated! The only issue was that the smoking area outside did not have the trash receptecle emptied once during my stay, so I was unable to properly dispose of trash and my cigarettes outside. I took the well put out butts inside to throw them away, which got weird looks from the front desk staff - but I've thrown them away in my room before and been accused of smoking in my room - so I now avoid that! I did not eat the breakfast offered, but my co-workers did, and had no complaints. The pool area seemed well kept, though the inside portion did seem a little stuffy due to the humidity, which is normal. This hotel is not in what I would consider walking distance to the strip. It is in walking distance to Terribles Casino, which we had a blast visiting! I'd stay here again for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Linens upon Check in...”
Reviews.Author: Appy97
Reviews.Content: During our most recent stay, bedding was not changed outwhen we turned down for the night. Long Black hairs found thru-out our sheets. Called downstairs to get housekeeping to change bedding, they send a Maintenance man, WE ARE TOLD BY HIM, NO HOUSEKEEPING STAFF @ NIGHT ??? The MAN DIDN'T EVEN KNOW WHAT SIZE BED WE HAD TO CHANGE THE LINENS."IS THAT A TWIN OR QUEEN HE STATED" NO- SORRY KING SIZE.New sheets brought up and handed to us. The front desk stated no other rooms available @ which point I started looking for new accomodations. The only thing the staff @ Front desk could offer was a 25.00 credit. Can't wait to post reviews on the internet about this one ! I'm sorry , but this WILL BE THE LAST STAY AT AN EMBASSY SUITES. I feel as if nobody cared downstairs and nobody offered any help in this matter. $25.00 refund was a joke, and makes me think about dropping HONORS program and possibly close my account, and discuss this with my Hilton American Express Card also. I certainly would love to hear from THE hotel manager for that facility and wonder why if your hotel is booked 100% , why a housekeeping staff member wasn't on the premises ? Especially at 100% occupancy ? p.s. not a quiet hotel !

Reviews.Title: “The best value hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DellaNice
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this particular Embassy Suites numerous times on business but we also enjoy holidaying in the West Coast and this hotel suits both business and leisure. Without a doubt it offers the best value of any hotel we've stayed. The suites are a great size and have all the mod cons. The bathrooms are very well sized and decorated to high standard. There is parking, an outdoor pool, a gift shop and everything you would expect from this hotel chain. The restaurant food is excellent particularly the breakfast is outstanding. The staff are first class and do all they can for you. A great bar area with complimentary popcorn and some wonderful cocktails (recommend the piña colada!). The lifts are fast and efficient which is a small point but makes a difference. All in a perfect stay for a perfect trip, everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Good Facilities and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: SriLanka2010
Reviews.Content: During one of my business visits to Las Vegas I happened to stay at this beautifu hotel as I could not get a hotel room at a reasonable rate in Las Vegas Blvd. It was a nice suprise and I am pleased that I did not stay anywhere else. What nice, clean hotel with so friendly staff. Its just 5 mins from major entertainment venues. The hotel is ideal for families with kids and also for businessmen who need concentration and relaxing. The eveniing Cocktail is so pleasent and B/F so good. Rooms very clean and well appointed. After this pleasent experience I have again booked this hotel for my next visit to Vegas in November 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Loristed
Reviews.Content: Driving up to the hotel is impressive. Modern glass structure standing proud on Paradise Ave. Containers of lemon ice water right inside the door was a welcome relief from the 100+ temperature outside. Desk reps were professional and friendly and promptly checked us in. The room was outstanding. Very clean and homey. Bed was comfortable. A good supply of coffee and tea in the small kitchen area. I didn't expect anything less just from my first impression of the lobby. Open, modern and the very beautiful fountain area is a great place to relax while waiting for a cab. The Manager's Reception and the breakfast buffet were two pluses for hungry guests. I was sorry are stay wasn't longer to enjoy this quiet location off of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, as expected from Embassy Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: toastydave
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May, and it was a great hotel, the breakfast and food in general were very good. the rooms were very big (all suites if you have not stayed at this chain before) , A lounge, kitchen obviously bedroom and bathroom two tv's and a desk ! its a bit off the strip so you will need either a car or you can take the free minivan from the hotel. This does have its good side, its nice to return to your confutable quite hotel after a evening of mayhem from the strip! Every evening there is a mangers reception with free snacks and beer, well if you can call it beer! Bud light ect! Staff are very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Loly07
Reviews.Content: Our room was ready as soon as we checked in at 8:00 a.m. After checking in we enjoyed the delicious complimentary breakfast. The manager's reception (with complimentary cocktails) was a nice way to start the evening before leaving the hotel for dinner. I really enjoyed getting away from the busy noise of the casinos and the crowd. It was nice coming to a quiet hotel after a busy evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel,location only issue.”
Reviews.Author: TheScanian
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel.Outstanding amenities,fantastic rooms. If you want to spend a few extra $$ I highly recommend getting a room with a large balcony. The balcony overlooks the Strip and the Golf Course at the Wynn/Encore.You can even see the fountains at Bellagio (albeit from a distance). Location is the only issue, an OK neighborhood,but probably not ideal for a late night walk.Also,no casino within a reasonable walking distance.Great breakfast (albeit crowded). Internet was fast,so no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip”
Reviews.Author: CA_Brz
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the strip. Good breakfasts and daily manager's receptions--beer, wine and mixed drinks. Pool area was very disappointing for a Southwest hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value - if you want to be just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dr_WarEagle
Reviews.Content: We checked in just in time for the start of the managers reception (with free beer and selected mixed drinks!). I was at first disappointed with the lack of a premium beer option (only bud, bud light, and michelob amber bock) but the amber bock was not bad. The bartenders were very courteous. We read other reviews on trip advisor warning of super slow internet speeds, but we had two computers and an iphone using the wireless with no notice of slow loading times. The room was very clean and golden (everything had gold). The room decor looked very outdated - especially the sofa. The small balcony was great, just enough to see part of the north end of the strip. We ate breakfast late and most of the fruit was gone, but we still had good cooked to order omelets. There was a shuttle that dropped off and picked up hotel guests on the north end of the strip on the bottom of every hour until 10:30PM. We wanted to go to the south end so we took a taxi (for about $10 each way). There is a monorail stop within walking distance at the convention center, which we did not use. After being inside of smoke-filled casinos and the strip littered with nude dancer cards, cigarette buts, beer cups, and tons of people, having a hotel off the strip was very very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: LindseyAndRicky
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a group of colleagues. Reasonable rates, with a Manager’s Reception that included ‘free’ drinks (adult and otherwise) and munchies. The breakfast buffet was decent with a nice omelet station, French toast, potatoes, fruit etc. There is something for everyone. The gym was the most complete gym I’ve seen in a mid-priced hotel. The room had a mini fridge but no microwave. The bedroom is separate from the ‘living area’, which is nice. There is a decent sized workspace in the living area and a mediocre desk in the bedroom. It is set a few blocks off the strip. There is a ton of restaurants nearby and it is a quick trip to the strip – walking distance if it is not too hot or you’re not too impaired (cab fare would be cheap). Overall, it was a nice hotel – I would stay there again. TIP: If you are a Hilton Honors member they will waive the internet charge ($10/day)…or at least they did for me. If you are not a Hilton Honors member, there is a free business center downstairs where you can get online, print etc.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Rocks”
Reviews.Author: BretG
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas usually twice a year to work on Nellis AFB. we stay for about a month each time. The Embassy is the best place to stay. The bar tenders are awesome "Sue Loraine and Tad", the front desk people are super helpful especially when you come in drunk and leave your wallet in the back of a cab. Amazing free breakfast, Free drinks from 5:30 to 7:30 every night. 1 mile from the strip and free shuttle. Once the bar staff gets to know you and you take care of them they will always take care of you. The Embassy will always be one of my first choices to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Booked by mistake, but liked it”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: I thought I had booked the other Embassy Suites on Paradise because I wanted to be close to the Hard Rock Hotel for a concert, so I was distressed when the cab kept going for seven blocks after we passed the Embassy Suites I thought I had booked. (How confusing is that that there are two Embassy Suites seven blocks apart on Paradise Road?) But what started out as a problem turned out fine because we liked the hotel and because it is a somewhat in the middle of nowhere we started taking the Monorail (a long three blocks from the hotel) and it turns out we really like the Monorail and will definitely use it from now on. The hotel itself is great - typical Embassy Suites - and the suites are really good sized. The staff were very helpful and always available to call a cab or whatever we needed. The bartender even kept the bar open late for us - we showed up for a drink while she was closing and she graciously agreed to serve us anyway. We probably won't stay there again because there are so many options in Vegas, but I certainly would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the Convention Center area. Also, there are a lot of really nice restaurants within walking distance (Moroccan, tapas, Malaysian, a couple of steakhouses, and Bahama Breeze, to name a few).

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Conraveler
Reviews.Content: Pluses: - Convenient walking location to Las Vegas Convention Center - Cooked-to-order breakfast included - Manager's afternoon reception included - On-site, basic dining - clean - typical Embassy Suites two room suite with microwave & refrigerator - convenience store nearby - clothes washer & drier - business center Minuses: - Pricey - Slow Internet - Can wait for a while for a cab - Rooms still "work" but tired decor

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but awful internet”
Reviews.Author: Punji
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler my criteria for a hotel is different than when I'm traveling for pleasure. #1 - Clean - Full credit here. Place was ell maintained and clean. #2 - Work Space - Full credit here. Standard Embassy layout. Plenty of space. Nice work area. #3 - Location - If you are headed to the Convention Center then it's great. To the strip less great. Shuttle only goes to the fashion mall on the strip. About and $8 cab ride before tip to/from the strip. #4 Internet connection - on a scale of 1 - 10 I give them a 1. It's awful. Painfully bad. Speed test in middle of the night gave <100K down and less that 25K up. #5 - Quiet - Very quiet. Especially compared to hotels on the strip. So overall average. If they would upgrade from a shared 26kpbs dial up for the entire hotel then they would be much better. the business center also had issues. Printer out of ink, loaded the printer with 3 whole punch paper.

Reviews.Title: “FIne for Business”
Reviews.Author: livinglarge
Reviews.Content: Found the Embassy perfect for our attendance at a conference down at the Convention Center. It was a fairly decent value when you consider the free hot breakfast and nightly manager's reception with snacks and drinks. We found the room clean and well laid out for the business traveler who may need a space to work from a lap top. The room was a bit dated however. We did take advantage of the outdoor hot tub one night...it was ok. I guess our biggest complaint would be a few mechanical things broken during our stay. One dryer was not working in the guest laundry as well as one printer in the business center. Also the hotel is in a somewhat "iffy" neighborhood. I did not feel unsafe however because we did not do much walking around the hotel. The Embassy did excel in service in 2 other areas however. Upon check-in, we informed them we would leave one day shorter from our original reservation and they kept our lower reservation rate. Also, they gave us two free meals at their Ridge view restaurant simply because my husband told her it was my birthday during our stay. Overall, we would stay here again if traveling for business.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ncgolf4man
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Within walking distance of "The Strip" and all that it offers!

Reviews.Title: “E”
Reviews.Author: fdtrcorey
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! the staff was awesome! the room was nice and the view was great!!! I found it better than staying on the strip cause of the views!

Reviews.Title: “Dull, lousy Internet”
Reviews.Author: Broken_Iris
Reviews.Content: After reading the mostly positive reviews, my coworkers and I chose to stay as a quiet, off-the-strip hotel that was non-smoking, non-gaming, and close to the airport. After spending four nights here, we were so bored we switched to over to the Paris casino (which ended up being cheaper than the Embassy and under government per-diem) and just put up with the ringing slot machines and smokey lobby. This hotel sucked the life out of the first half of our stay. The Embassy Suites was exactly what an Embassy Suites should be and I after staying in them for nearly 30 nights last year, I would know. Same amenities, same bed, same alarm clock, same breakfast options, everything you expect, minus two big things. This hotel is not quiet. The atrium acts as an echo chamber and even though I was on the top floor towards the back, I could hear kids at the pool every morning. This hotel is not in the flight path for McCarran Airport, but it is in the flight path for Nellis AFB and those long range transports make a heck of a lot more noise than a 747. The other big thing, and this was the primary driver for our move, the internet connection was unusable. The hotel is completely wireless and the network quickly gets saturated. There are Ethernet ports on the wall by the phone, but the staff informed me that they are decorative, not functional. DSLreports had my connection speed at 30kbps the Tuesday night I was there. That's below 1994 AOL speeds. At that speed my VPN connection couldn't stay up and I ended doing work on my phone. Ever tried to work on presentations on an iphone? Also, be prepared to wait for machines at the gym each morning. There are three treadmills and two ellipticals and many of our servicemen stay here, so those guys are up and rolling at 5am to work out each day. There are other drawbacks as well, such as the surrounding neighborhood. Mostly low rent apartments and no-tell motels. The only food within walking distance in the Envy Steakhouse in the Marriott and a McDonald's. Who goes to Vegas and eats at McDonald's? If you look at the map, it appears there are a great deal of restaurants with half mile, but with Paradise Road being torn up to replace water mains, and the shady neighborhood, it's not a trek I was willing to take. On the plus side, I did have a decent view of the strip from my balcony. I would call it more of a tease than a view. If you are reading this, you were probably looking for a hotel with the attributes I was. Hilton brand, away from the strip, quick commute, quiet, easy to get some work done. Just prepare to be disappointed or look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's just okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: Storm_Chasers
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites seem to be a "hit or miss" property. Some are outstanding, but this one left us wanting more. Upon check-in the staff was rushed and rude. When we entered our room, it was the standard Embassy Suites set-up. A liiving room with couch and table, a wet bar and separate bedroom. It was fairly clean, except for the red stain on the ceiling. I'm not really sure what it was, and frankly, I don't want to know. I reported the stain to the front desk and they wrote down our room number. Nothing much was said about it. The nice perk of staying at the Embassy Suites is the "Manager's Reception" that includes appetizers (nachos and popcorn) and complimentary cocktails. It is only offered during certain times each night. The bartender at this property was wonderful and I wish I had written down her name to give her kuddos! The complimentary cooked to order breakfast was excellent! Everything was fresh and the food was fairly tasty. The location of this property is in a questionable area. It probably isn't the safest place to be outside of at night. It is a pretty quick taxi ride to the strip. It was around $5 or $6.

Reviews.Title: “very, very noisey hotel”
Reviews.Author: cream63
Reviews.Content: If you are sound sensitive this is not the place for you, if you dont mind the noise its not a bad place, could do better , could do worrse. I checked in and asked for a quiet room was pleased to get an end room with a nice view, but it was right above very loud road construction and later had to endure very noisey drunks in bar on mezzanine right below me, I was told they would quiet down at 7pm, than 730 than maybe 930..was offered different rooms but all of the rooms had a very very noisey HVAC system that had a constant hummmm that was very annoying. I know from previous stays in nearby hotels the airplane noise is worse at other end Also was expecting a nice balcony but in reality it is only maybe 18" wide, just enough to stand there. The good: Very good front desk, especially the women on 2nd shift (Silver?) decent bathroom, good bed, nice view, quick shuttle to the strip, room was fresh and not too heavy on air freshener like some places. The bad: Road traffic noise, road construction noise, airplane noise, noisey hum in room from hvac, noisey bar patrons in atrium, food and service in restaurant need some improvement, plates for breakfast buffet dirty, fitness center disapointing, two long black hairs in bathroom sink that were not mine, slight cigarette odor coming from bathroom vent

Reviews.Title: “where do you get this type of value when you're a family of 5?”
Reviews.Author: Mjasboz
Reviews.Content: Our check-in started off poorly; with hindsight let's also put it down to a long 14 hour trip to get there. Front desk staff fantastic BUT we changed rooms three times. rooms are spacious and comfortable BUT dusty and attention to detail lacking! Eventually we found the perfectr room and the managers had it cleaned top to bottom - for us that's the way any room should be when checking in! Breakfast very, very good and too tempting.
